main event: A civilian in New York City reported a round object with an object hanging underneath, possibly a radio-sonde balloon, drifting slowly towards the East for about 10 minutes.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 10 minutes and involved a single unidentified object observed through field glasses.
There were no photographs of the object present in the report.
The description of the object closely matched a radio-sonde balloon that was released from Idlewild about 15 minutes before the sighting.
The possibility of the object being a radio-sonde balloon was mentioned in the conclusions of the report.
The incident was reported by telephone, and the reliability of the observers was uncertain.
sighted object: Round object with an object hanging underneath
